              def next_question_index(all_questions:, criteria_keys: [], previous_question_index: 0)
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                available_questions = all_questions[previous_question_index..] || []
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

            
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                relative_next_question_index = available_questions.find_index { |question| question.show?(criteria_keys) }
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                relative_next_question_index ? previous_question_index + relative_next_question_index : nil
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              end

              def previous_question_index(all_questions:, criteria_keys: [], current_question_index: 0)
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                previous_questions = all_questions[0...current_question_index]
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                previous_questions.rindex { |question| question.show?(criteria_keys) }
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      47.

      48.

              def notification_email_link(non_tracked_url, notification)
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                url = Addressable::URI.parse(non_tracked_url)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50.

    app/lib/search/filter_query_builder.rb

            # Used by by Search::QueryBuilder to build the `filter` part of the Rummager
          
      2.

            # search query. This will determine the documents that are returned from rummager.
          
      3.

            1
            

            

            module Search

            1
            

            

              class FilterQueryBuilder

            1
            

            

                def initialize(facets:, user_params:)
          
      6.

            112
            

            

                  @facets = facets

                end
          
      9.

      10.

            1
            

            

                def call
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11.

                def sort_batch_results(raw_results)

    60. 
            
            

            

                  case @order
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  when "most-viewed"
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                    raw_results.sort_by { |hash| hash["popularity"] }.reverse
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  when "most-recent"
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                    raw_results.sort_by { |hash| hash["public_timestamp"] }.reverse
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  when "a-to-z"

                # search-api rejects queries which are longer than this, but an
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                # error page isn't a good experience for users.  There are some
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                # legitimate queries over this length (people typing a length

                # question into the search box), so rather than give them an error
          
      9.

      10.

                  raw_facets.select do |facet|
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            318
            

            

                    facet.fetch("combine_mode", "and") == "and"
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                end

                def or_filter_queries
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            86
            

            

                  @or_filter_queries ||= or_filter_params
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                    .map do |k, v|
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                      { "filter_#{k}" => v }
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                    end

                  raw_facets.select do |facet|

            318
            

            

                    facet.fetch("combine_mode", "and") == "or"

                def filter_queries

            86
            

            

                  (and_filter_query.empty? ? [] : [and_filter_query]) + or_filter_queries

                def reject_query

            56

                def facet_query
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            56
            

            

                  dynamic_facet_params = facets_not_overridden_by_registries(facet_params)

            56

                def facets_not_overridden_by_registries(facet_params)
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            116
            

            

                  facet_params.reject { |k, _v| Services.registries.all.key?(k) }
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

            
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            1
            

            

                def count_dynamic_facets(facet_names)
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            56
            

            

                  facet_names.each do |name|
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                    GovukStatsd.increment "search_with_#{name}_facet"
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

            
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            1

              def process_delimited_dates(date_string)

              def process_number_only_inputs(date_string)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                case date_string.length
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                when 4
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  # Catches if user inputs just year which Chronic would parse as a time. e.g. "2008" as "8:08pm"
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  "01/01/#{date_string}"
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                when 8
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  # Catches fully padded dates without delimiters, eg 01012001
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  date_string.gsub(/(\d{2})(\d{2})(\d{4})/, '\1/\2/\3')
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                when 6
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  # Catches fully padded dates without delimiters with abreviated year, eg 010101
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  date_string.gsub(/(\d{2})(\d{2})(\d{2})/, '\1/\2/\3')
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  # Catches if user inputs an incorrect number of digits, which Chronic would parse as a time. e.g
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  # "100" as todays's date at 13:00, or "10011" as today's date at 13:00:11
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  date_string.replace(" ")
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

            
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

              # Catches if user input could be a month name which chronic would parse as this year
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

              # for months prior to now, and next year for months ahead of now
          
      73.

            1
            

            

              def process_month_name_inputs(date_string)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            136
            

            

                guessed_date = Chronic.parse(date_string, guess: :begin)
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            136
            

            

                if guessed_date
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  guessed_year = guessed_date.year
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  this_year = Time.zone.now.year
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  guessed_year != this_year ? guessed_date - 1.year : guessed_date
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

              end

              def search_params(params = {})
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                default_search_params.merge(params).to_a.map { |tuple|
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                  tuple.join("=")
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                }.join("&")
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273.

              def policy_and_engagement_results_for_policy_papers_json

            require "gds_api/test_helpers/content_store"

            module TaxonomySpecHelper
          
      5.

              def has_taxons(taxon_hashes)
